articles.headline: Quest Acknowledges Errors in Vitamin D Tests
articles.snippet: Quest Diagnostics provided possibly erroneous results to thousands of people who had their vitamin D levels tested in the last two years.
articles.abstract: Quest Diagnostics provided possibly erroneous results to thousands of people who had their vitamin D levels tested in the last two years.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s largest medical laboratory company provided possibly erroneous results to thousands of people who had their vitamin D levels tested in the last two years, the company has acknowledged.

articles.headline: Many Ways to Plug In to Tech Savings
articles.snippet: When every $100 counts, here are a few suggestions for using high-tech gadgetry to save you money.
articles.abstract: When every $100 counts, here are a few suggestions for using high-tech gadgetry to save you money.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s a new year, all right, but economically, it still feels a lot like the old one. Seems that everywhere you look, things are being downsized: companies, paychecks, parties, trade shows and on and on. People aren’t just tightening their belts; they’re punching new holes in them.

articles.headline: For Pittsburgh, There’s Life After Steel
articles.snippet: The city’s reinvented economy, driven by health care and education, is proving resistant to downturns.
articles.abstract: The city’s reinvented economy, driven by health care and education, is proving resistant to downturns.
articles.lead_paragraph: PITTSBURGH  This is what life in one American city looks like after an industrial collapse:

articles.headline: Gaza War Role Is Political Lift for Ex-Premier
articles.snippet: The popularity of Israel’s Defense Minister Ehud Barak is soaring, yet he was not eager to strike Hamas.
articles.abstract: The popularity of Israel’s Defense Minister Ehud Barak is soaring, yet he was not eager to strike Hamas.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM  A few weeks ago, Defense Minister Ehud Barak was considered a dead man walking in Israeli politics. Members of his Labor Party were plotting to replace him after elections on Feb. 10, if not before. Under his leadership, the storied party of David Ben-Gurion and Golda Meir had sunk so low in the polls that there was serious talk it might disappear.

articles.headline: China Losing Taste for Debt From U.S.
articles.snippet: As the global downturn has intensified, Beijing is starting to keep more of its money at home, which could have painful effects for U.S. borrowers.
articles.abstract: As the global downturn has intensified, Beijing is starting to keep more of its money at home, which could have painful effects for U.S. borrowers.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — China has bought more than $1 trillion of American debt, but as the global downturn has intensified, Beijing is starting to keep more of its money at home, a move that could have painful effects for American borrowers.

articles.headline: A Crisis Trumps Constraint
articles.snippet: Economists and politicians across the political spectrum say Congress should spend whatever it takes to rescue the economy.
articles.abstract: Economists and politicians across the political spectrum say Congress should spend whatever it takes to rescue the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  As the ranking Democrat and then chairman of the House Budget Committee, Representative John M. Spratt Jr. of South Carolina accused President Bush for eight years of recklessly running up huge fiscal deficits.

articles.headline: Purple Heart Is Ruled Out for Traumatic Stress
articles.snippet: The decision ends hope of recent war veterans who have the condition that the medal could honor their sacrifice.
articles.abstract: The decision ends hope of recent war veterans who have the condition that the medal could honor their sacrifice.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Pentagon has decided that it will not award the Purple Heart, the hallowed medal given to those wounded or killed by enemy action, to war veterans who suffer from post-traumatic stress disorder because it is not a physical wound.
articles.byline: By Lizette Alvarez and Erik Eckholm

articles.headline: Obama Promises Bid to Overhaul Retiree Spending
articles.snippet: Should the president-elect take on a serious effort to address the growing costs of entitlement programs, he would be opening up a potentially risky battle.
articles.abstract: Should the president-elect take on a serious effort to address the growing costs of entitlement programs, he would be opening up a potentially risky battle.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  President-elect Barack Obama said Wednesday that overhauling Social Security and Medicare would be “a central part” of his administration’s efforts to contain federal spending, signaling for the first time that he would wade into the thorny politics of entitlement programs.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and John Harwood

articles.headline: Financial Scandal at Outsourcing Company Rattles a Developing Country
articles.snippet: Satyam Computer Services, one of India’s largest outsourcing companies, significantly inflated earnings and assets for years, the chairman said before resigning.
articles.abstract: Satyam Computer Services, one of India’s largest outsourcing companies, significantly inflated earnings and assets for years, the chairman said before resigning.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI  Ramalinga Raju was contrite, sort of.

articles.headline: U.N. and Red Cross Add to Outcry on Gaza War
articles.snippet: The U.N. Security Council passed a resolution calling for a cease-fire, and the Red Cross accused Israel of neglecting the injured.
articles.abstract: The U.N. Security Council passed a resolution calling for a cease-fire, and the Red Cross accused Israel of neglecting the injured.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — International aid groups lashed out at Israel on Thursday over the war in Gaza, saying that access to civilians in need is poor, relief workers are being hurt and killed, and Israel is woefully neglecting its obligations to Palestinians who are trapped, some among rotting corpses in a nightmarish landscape of deprivation.

articles.headline: After Weak Holiday Sales, Retailers Prepare for Even Worse
articles.snippet: The nation’s retail chains confirmed that they suffered one of the worst holiday seasons in decades.
articles.abstract: The nation’s retail chains confirmed that they suffered one of the worst holiday seasons in decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: Judgment day is at hand for American retailers.
